title: How to jungle now?
body: No pots on first back? What is the sense in this?

replies.body: The pacifist in the river is the number one creep in this game. you get hp and mana back from it, position, and time for natural regen. And the ward.  Keep roaming and never go home.
i find that taking the scuttle can take sometime especially when you are on your first clear so i just dont take it
My first clear is probably equivocal to 3 of yours. Stay in lane control game.

Buy trailblazer on your first back since it gives you health/mana when you smite.

On your 2nd or 3rd back (before finishing your jungle item) trade it for whatever other smite you want.

you can get pots on your first back if you feel you'll need them for ganking after clearing jungle but I've seen some people not take pots and thats how they play the jungle though I will usually still get one or two pots depending on my clear path. On blue side i have 2 clear paths one for champs who can clear the jg first time then recall and one for champs that need to recall after half clearing the jg:

full clear blue side path:

Krugs (smite for buff) get a decent leash from botlane
Red Brambleback (red buff)
wolves
gromp (smite)
Blue Sentinel (blue buff)
you can recall or go to raptors then recall depending on your health situation

you should have enough to get you smite upgrade and boots and maybe a pot if you did a 100% clear

and the half clear blue side path:

Krugs (smite) get a decent leash from botlane
Red Brambleback
Wolves (smite) then recall get your upgrade if you can afford it
Gromp (smite)
Blue Sentinel
Raptors then Recall

you should then have enough for your upgrade/tier one boots and part of your smite enchant if your going the tanky enchant you dont really need health pots but you might pick up one or 2 mana pots depending on who you play

and for Red side I usually only need one clear path which is:

Gromp (smite)
Blue Sentinel
Wolves
Krugs (smite)
Red Brambleback
then if your up for it Raptors then recall or just recall after Red you should be able to get your smite upgrade, tier one boots and maybe a potion

then take a look at the lanes is any lane pushing towards your nexus if so check out your teammates health if they are healthy then go and gank that lane or if your team is pushing in all the lanes go back to the jungle and start clearing again
